title: Patient Services Coordinator
description:
Overview:
**How you move is why we’re here.** **®**  

**Now more than ever.**
Get back to what you need and love to do.
The possibilities are endless...  

Now more than ever, our guiding principles are helping us in our search for exceptional talent - candidates who align with our unique workplace culture and who want to maximize
 the abundant opportunities for growth and success.  

If this describes you then let’s talk!  

HSS is consistently among the top-ranked hospitals for orthopedics and rheumatology by *U.S. News & World Report*. As a recipient of the *Magnet* Award for Nursing Excellence, HSS was the first hospital in New York City to receive the distinguished designation. Whether you are early in your career or an expert in your field, you will find HSS an innovative, supportive and inclusive environment.
Working with colleagues who love what they do and are deeply committed to our Mission, you too can be part of our transformation across the enterprise. **Patient Services Coordinator**

**Full-Time**

**9am-5pm**

 **Hybrid: 1 day a week after 6-month probation**

 **Department of Medicine Patient Services Coordinator**

 **Overview:**


A highly-visible role responsible for coordinating the day-to-day administrative operations of multiple physician practices in the Department of Medicine- Rheumatology. The Patient Services Coordinator is an expert in all administrative aspects related to high-quality, efficient patient care. Specific responsibilities include:

* Answering and appropriately documenting and triaging all patient calls;
* Returning appropriate calls on behalf of physician;
* Scheduling patient appointments and completing a full patient registration when appropriate;
* Managing physician clinical, research and administrative schedules;
* Assisting with urgent patient issues as directed by the physician;
* Managing physician /patient correspondence through the hospital’s electronic medical record;
* Providing administrative support for physician dictation activity;
* Compiling physician expense reports and reimbursement requests and tracking physician spending;
* Maintaining inventory of office supplies and ordering supplies as needed;
* Providing back-up to other roles in the department as needed;
* Additional administrative responsibilities as directed by the physician, the supervisor or department leadership.


Qualifications:
**Competencies/skills:**

* Superior written and oral communication skills
* Exceptional customer service and interpersonal skills
* Proven track record of building and maintaining productive working relationships with physicians
* Ability to work collaboratively as part of a team; offers to help coworkers when needed
* Detail oriented with ability to multi-task
* Strong critical thinking and organizational skills
* Demonstrated ability to take initiative and ownership over one’s work
* Aptitude for problem-solving
* Consistently displays a positive attitude towards one’s work and work environment
* Consistently displays professional appearance
* Experience with Epic preferred; strong computer skills required
* In-depth understanding of medical office workflows, systems and processes
* Knowledge of healthcare and health insurance, preferred
* Familiarity with medical terminology, preferred
* Bachelor’s degree preferred, associate’s degree required. Experience may be considered in lieu of education.


Other Requirements: #LI-Onsite Pay Range - Minimum: USD $32.97/Hr. Pay Range - Maximum: USD $37.36/Hr.

* Escorting patients to exam rooms and preparing them for examinations, reviewing patient statuses and assisting in obtaining patient data.
* Obtain PCR nasal swabs for pre-surgical patients
* Support the Pre-Surgical Screening program by assisting nurses and obtaining vital signs, lab specimens (venipuncture) and EKG’s.

* Demonstrate proficiency in cast removal, suture and staple removal, and application of off the shelf braces.

* 2 years experience as a Medical Assistant/Nursing Technician/EMT or Military Corpsman with minimum 1 year experience in orthopedic practice or other surgical subspecialty in an ambulatory setting.
* BLS Certification

title: Clinical Project Manager, Information Technology Portfolio Management
description:
Overview:
**How you move is why we’re here.** **®**  

**Now more than ever.**
Get back to what you need and love to do.
The possibilities are endless...  

Now more than ever, our guiding principles are helping us in our search for exceptional talent - candidates who align with our unique workplace culture and who want to maximize
 the abundant opportunities for growth and success.  

If this describes you then let’s talk!  

HSS is consistently among the top-ranked hospitals for orthopedics and rheumatology by *U.S. News & World Report*. As a recipient of the *Magnet* Award for Nursing Excellence, HSS was the first hospital in New York City to receive the distinguished designation. Whether you are early in your career or an expert in your field, you will find HSS an innovative, supportive and inclusive environment.
Working with colleagues who love what they do and are deeply committed to our Mission, you too can be part of our transformation across the enterprise **Clinical Project Manager, Information Technology Portfolio Management****Full-Time** **Overview:**  

The Clinical Project Manager leads and coordinates inter-departmental and organizational wide projects, in addition to supporting IT Applications with their initiatives. The Project Manager will be an integral member of the IT Applications Program Office and support change management, process optimization and adoption, and documentation in pursuit of strategic initiatives.  

  

  



**Who will love this job:**

* **An organizer** who will keep multiple projects running on time and budget while balancing competing tasks for yourself and others.
* **A strategist** who will assist in project planning and execution. Understanding key goals and satisfying a diverse group of stakeholders and their priorities.
* **An adapter** who is comfortable working as part of a team-based portfolio and supporting other’s work-styles and requests for custom materials.
* **A collaborator** who will liaise and coordinate across the organization and be a primary point of contact for internal and vendor team members.
* **A proud evangelist** who will advocate project management principles, and the ability to transfer that knowledge to HSS staff and end-users through the creation of best-practice materials.
* **A communicator and presenter** who will effectively provide concise status updates on all projects and represent the team in management venues.

 **What You'll Do:**

* Be a founding member of the IT Applications Program Office, reporting to the Director, to support Enterprise strategic initiatives within the clinical portfolio (Epic clinical applications: Inpatient, Willow, Ambulatory, MyHSS, Optime/Anesthesia, Radiant, Beaker).
	+ Have a deep understanding of the clinical workflows and hospital operations to be a strategic partner to the wider business, acting as the primary interface between IT and Operations.
	+ Ensure organization alignment with the Enterprise PMO and Technical PMO across cross-portfolio objectives and advising hospital leaders.
* Create and maintain project tools and processes based on best practices for cross-team use: project plans, issue and enhancement trackers, training companions, agenda templates, executive engagement/escalation, change management, etc.
	+ Coordinate and collaborate with the Enterprise PMO and Technical PMO.
	+ Develop and maintain project management training for the department, including consultative services.
	+ Strategize and oversee the development, implementation, and maintenance lifecycles of multiple clinical and regulatory projects simultaneously, including:
* **Plan and Execute:**
	+ Create project plans.
	+ Write SOWs and manage future service purchases.
	+ Facilitate the completion of project scope/resource requirements, project charter, and lessons learned documentation.
	+ Define and tracking all tasks, milestones, and deliverables.
	+ Manage project deadlines and hold the team accountable for deliverables.
	+ Assist staff with research, meeting scheduling and facilitating, note taking/follow up, and general team coordination.
	+ Take ownership of issues and the delivery of resolutions. Track all issues and risks with the appropriate tools.
	+ Monitor and track all projects with the appropriate tools, and report statuses regularly to stakeholder groups.
* **Learn and Grow:**
	+ Research new methods for enhancing performance, and track project interventions with positive outcomes.
	+ Complete project assessments to innovate new processes and tools for the organization.

  


Qualifications:
**Qualifications:**

* A bachelor’s degree at a 4-year institution; preferred majors in computer science,
* Epic clinical application training or certification.
* Demonstrated ability to manage and work well in a team, navigate complicated governance structures, remove roadblocks for team members, and adapt to a constantly changing healthcare environment with competing priorities.
* Proven comfort with strategic planning, risk management, conflict resolution, and change management.
* Excellent interpersonal, oral, and written skills; collaborative; assertive; strategic and tactful.
* Advanced knowledge of the Microsoft suite of products.
* Expertise in project management software (i.e., Jira, Monday.com, Smartsheet) and working knowledge of Lean/Agile practices preferred.
* Willingness to work a flexible schedule according to business requirements.

*The ideal candidate will have:*

* At least 5 years of experience working as a Project/Program/Portfolio Manager in a high intensity environment; healthcare and Epic experience preferred.
* PMP, PgMP, PfMP, PMI-ACP, DASSM, CSM, SAFe Agilist certifications preferred.
* Experience with OKRs preferred.


Other Requirements: #LI-Hybrid Pay Range - Minimum: USD $100,000.00/Yr. Pay Range - Maximum: USD $135,000.00/Yr.

title: Manager, Strategic Sourcing Contract Orthopedics
description:
Overview:
**How you move is why we’re here.** **®**  

**Now more than ever.**
Get back to what you need and love to do.
The possibilities are endless...  

Now more than ever, our guiding principles are helping us in our search for exceptional talent - candidates who align with our unique workplace culture and who want to maximize
 the abundant opportunities for growth and success.  

If this describes you then let’s talk!  

HSS is consistently among the top-ranked hospitals for orthopedics and rheumatology by *U.S. News & World Report*. As a recipient of the *Magnet* Award for Nursing Excellence, HSS was the first hospital in New York City to receive the distinguished designation. Whether you are early in your career or an expert in your field, you will find HSS an innovative, supportive and inclusive environment.
Working with colleagues who love what they do and are deeply committed to our Mission, you too can be part of our transformation across the enterprise. **Manager, Strategic Sourcing Contract Orthopedics****Full-Time** **Overview:**  

HSS Supply Chain Management specializes in the strategic sourcing of goods, services, and medical equipment while managing vital functions such as strategic planning, contract negotiation, distribution & pricing strategies, that together enable the delivery of highest standards of orthopedics healthcare and foster partnerships with customers and suppliers.  

The Strategic Sourcing department oversees critical supplier relationship management and contract management processes to ensure that contract terms are met, and termination dates are monitored. Responsibilities include analyzing product and services cost structures to develop short- and long- range plans to improve sourcing costs and vendor performance, opportunities to consolidate suppliers, partner with departmental stakeholders to set purchasing standards, improve negotiations and reduce the total cost of ownership for products and services.  

The Sourcing Contract Manager specifically uses their contract management expertise to draft, review, and negotiate contracts with suppliers, ensure that all contracts comply with procurement policies and legal requirements, and manage the contract lifecycle, including renewals, amendments, and terminations. Additionally, the Sourcing Contract Manager works closely with legal team to ensure that procurement requirements are met and support all contract-related matters, as well as facilitate effective communication and collaboration between internal departments and external suppliers. **SUMMARY OF DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

 **Contract Background** – Reviews contracts, terms and conditions, and ramifications of contractual verbiage as it relates to the product, service, supplier in question and those ramifications within the hospital. Develops contracts supporting HSS business requirements, including clearly defined service expectations/goods specifications, performance measurement practices and shortfall remedies. Leverage HSS ERP and CLM tools to streamline administrative contract life cycle process.* **Supplier Relationship Management** – Manages and enhances existing contracts with key suppliers through quarterly business reviews. Identifies and implements changes to help strengthen business partnerships.
* **Supplier Selection and Contracting** – Establishes business cases supporting sourcing recommendations. Conducts negotiations with suppliers on pricing and contractual terms and conditions and develops contracts supporting HSS business requirements, including clearly defined service expectations/goods specifications, performance measurement practices and shortfall remedies.
* **Analytics Skills** – Analyze and interpret data both financially and qualitatively to present, interpret outcomes, and make data driven recommendations to leadership.
* **Market Evaluations** – Interprets market and competitive intelligence through formal and informal processes. Advocates competitive decision-making in the most efficient, least resource-intense process and evaluates supplier capabilities to meet HSS needs through fair and thorough techniques.
* **Sourcing Strategies** - Defines sourcing strategies that optimize value considering requestor/end-user needs and market Ensures the team achieves project timing, service, and savings objectives. Identify the most beneficial means to access markets and drive the supplier’s behavior accordingly.
* **Sourcing Projects** - Assess needs and initiates projects with key stakeholders based on high spend profile, potential for savings, upcoming contract expirations, process improvement, capital projects, and value analysis related initiatives. Initiate and manage RFx events to ensure HSS is receiving the best value.
* Drives departmental culture and promotes data-driven decision-making, consumer-driven analytics, marketing, and investment planning across the department.
* Provides management visibility into data-driven insights that inform the department’s strategic direction and KPI’s and determine the adoption of suitable toolsets that drive innovation.
* Assess the total financial value of sourcing events, identify risks of growth opportunities as well as provide analytics that will position the business for dynamic growth.

**INTERPERSONAL SKILLS:** The Strategic Sourcing Manager must be detail oriented, collaborative, self-motivated requiring minimal supervision, proactive, creative, an independent thinker, have superior problem-solving skills, have a positive can-do attitude, and demonstrate composure in times of uncertainty and stress.**LEADERSHIP SKILLS:** The Strategic Sourcing Manager must demonstrate an ability to inspire and collaborate cross functionally and influence the decision-making process through data, analytics, and strategic insights.


Qualifications:
**YEARS OF EXPERIENCE:**
========================


A highly experienced healthcare professional with at least five years of experience in Strategic Sourcing, two of which specialize in the Orthopedics product spend category.**EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:**
=========================

* Bachelor’s degree required (preferably healthcare administration/supply chain).
* Master’s degree (preferred).
* Project Management Professional (PMP) certification (preferred).

**COMPUTER PROGRAM/SOFTWARE OPERATED REQUIRED:**
================================================

* ERP platforms and OR Inventory Management Systems
* MS Visio, Project, Word, PowerPoint
* Adobe Acrobat

 **PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS/WORKING CONDITIONS:** Work is primarily sedentary in nature and performed in a normal business office environment. No special physical demands are required.**RISK OF EXPOSURE TO BLOODBORNE PATHOGENS:** Category III-Tasks that involve NO exposure to blood, body fluids or tissues, and Category I tasks that are not a condition of employment.


Other Requirements: #LI-Hybrid Pay Range - Minimum: USD $125,000.00/Yr. Pay Range - Maximum: USD $145,000.00/Yr.
ceo_name: Dr Bryan T. Kelly, MD, MBA

title: Creative Consultant
description:
*Please note the specific instructions at the end of this job posting before* *submitting* *your application.*

 **Position Description**  

As a **Creative Consultant** at Lippincott, you will play an integral role in shaping today’s leading brands and bringing them to life through strategy, experience, innovation, and design. You will apply strategic, analytical, and creative thinking on a daily basis to solve challenges for clients. You will also consult across industries, addressing a range of topics including brand positioning, brand messaging, brand architecture, naming, and marketing and customer strategy.  

  

On any given day, you could be naming an AI digital assistant, revitalizing a leading retailer’s positioning or crafting an airline’s customer and employee experience. We’ll encourage you to think and work in new ways.

 **Once here, you can expect to:**

* Apply innovative thinking and problem-solving to complex challenges
* Research customer needs through focus groups, day-in-the-life studies, interviews, and more
* Generate quantitative and qualitative insights, and weave them together into a compelling story
* Perform comprehensive brand experience audits across multiple touchpoints
* Translate strategy solutions into culture, business, and experience innovations for purpose-driven brands.
* Collaborate across external client and internal Lippincott teams
* Integrate design thinking and creative concept development into your work
  

  

**We’d love to hear from you if:**

* You think critically, logically and creatively
* You have an interest and aptitude for understanding how businesses work, create profit and connect with audiences
* You can apply your writing and presenting skills to tell clear, compelling stories
* You have a dedicated work ethic and passion for branding, innovation, experience and design
* You conduct research and distill findings effectively and efficiently
* You have strong organizational and task management skills
* You work effectively and professionally in a team setting – including with clients
* You are proficient in PowerPoint and Excel
 **Eligibility****:**


To be considered for this position, you must:

* Be a college senior receiving your bachelor's degree in spring or summer of 2025
* Have a GPA of 3.4 or higher
* Have unrestricted eligibility to work in the United States
 **Instructions for your Application:**


Materials required with your application:  

Please submit a resume and cover letter with your online application. Your cover letter must address the following questions in 500 words or less:

* Why are you interested in a career in branding?
* What would be a dream brand for you to work on and why?
 *Please note, any application received without a cover letter will not be put forward for consideration**.*

 ***For students*** ***attending*** ***Howard University, New York University, University of Maryland, University of Pennsylvania, University of Virginia, and Yale******,******please apply through your school's job board to align with your school's*** ***recruitment*** ***timeline.***

 **Timeline**

**The final date to apply for this position will be September 10, 2024 at 11:59pm**.


We’ll let you know if you’re selected for an interview in mid-September.  

The starting date for this full-time, permanent position will be September 2025.

 *The applicable base pay for this role is $82,000.*

 *The base pay offered will be determined on factors such as experience, skills, training, location, certifications, and education. Decisions will be determined on a case-by-case basis. In addition to the base salary, this position will be eligible for performance-based incentives.*

 **About Lippincott:**


Lippincott is a creative consultancy specializing in brand and innovation. We have a passion for solving our clients’ toughest challenges with a proven combination of strategic rigor and design excellence. A pioneer since 1943, we have shaped some of the world’s most iconic brands and experiences.


We recognize the benefits of flexibility but also value the interactions that happen when we come together. Our new hybrid working model allows individuals to set their own cadence for working in their preferred environment with the expectation that they will be spending at least half of their time (50%) in their local office each month.

 **Who We Are, Together…**


We embody key values that drive our culture. We demand better, reach higher, and expect more of ourselves and our colleagues. We demonstrate gratitude, offer support, and embrace optimism every day. We celebrate debate, discussion, disagreement, and feedback, with an open mind to new ways of thinking and doing. We act with passion, intention, and goodwill while building on and elevating everyone’s contributions and sharing in our collective success.

  

In our pursuit to make it meaningful, we want our people to feel heard, respected and valued through our words and actions – goals we can only achieve with a sustained commitment to inclusion, diversity and belonging. We seek the best and brightest ideas from a diverse representation of backgrounds and experiences because we know that’s what it takes to continuously push the boundaries, solve our clients’ most complex challenges, and foster an inspiring culture of rigorous creativity. We celebrate and leverage our differences and our commonalities, so everyone feels safe, supported and encouraged to be wide open, to say “yes, and!” and to demand better of ourselves and one another. We aspire to be positive role models for inclusion at an individual level, corporate level, and societal level.

*Lippincott is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All employment decisions at Lippincott are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications without regard to race, national origin, age, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran or disability status or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in locations where we operate. We are committed to promoting a workplace of which we can all be proud.*  

  

#Lippincott

title: BD and Marketing Assistant
description:
Summary:

The Business Development and Marketing Assistant is a key team member within the Marketing Department. The Assistant supports the regional Business Development and Marketing team with a variety of activities focused on promoting the lawyers and practices in the region and enabling client engagement, as described below. They take an active role in learning about the lawyers, practices, and clients of the Firm and work closely with colleagues across offices and functions to assist with a range of integrated business development and marketing efforts.


Duties and Responsibilities:
* Coordinates the production and distribution of various legal updates sent to clients, including formatting documents for print, web, and email, obtaining appropriate approvals from lawyers and colleagues, posting to the website and other databases, and creating post-distribution readership reports
* Works with the marketing team to plan and execute Firm sponsored and hosted client events, including distributing invitations, processing registrations, maintaining registration lists, coordinating the production of event materials, staffing the events, and assisting with post-event follow up
* Supports the office’s client entertainment activities, including management of the Firm’s ticket assets and allocation system
* Coordinates with the Digital Communications team to maintain website content and execute social media campaigns
* Assists in drafting internal announcements as well as news items for the website and social media platforms
* Assists with the preparation and tracking of regional awards and rankings submissions
* Coordinates sponsorships for regional conferences and seminars
* Coordinates with the Creative team to develop and distribute event invitations and sponsorship ads
* Drafts and updates lawyer biographies
* Coordinates professional photos for lawyers
* Manages office inventory of client gifts
* Generates and updates marketing materials as requested by Department members, such as brochures and presentations
* Maintains the Firm’s CRM system: tracks activities for clients, alumni, and friends of the Firm; ensures that contact information is accurate and up-to-date and that contacts are associated with the proper mailing lists; generates and formats reports as needed; and guides secretaries in the effective use of the CRM system
* Assists in maintaining and updating marketing department databases and records to track regional events, rankings and awards, experience, team calendar, etc.
* Performs basic research and data collection on clients and contacts, industries, and competitors
* Maintains accurate records for marketing expenses and prepares payment requests for approval
* Assists with the Marketing Department’s support of other Firm departments (HR and Recruiting, CLE, Diversity, Pro Bono, etc.)
* Interacts with vendors as needed
* Administrative and other projects as assigned


New York Applicants: Salaries may vary by location. In New York, the estimated target salary range of this role is $59,000 – $65,000, in addition to bonus eligibility and a comprehensive benefit package. Salary determinations are made based on numerous factors, such as, but not limited to, the relevant market and the skill, experience, class or graduation year, and education of the selected candidate.
Qualifications:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the Duties and Responsibilities (Duties) above satisfactorily and meet the requirements below. The requirements listed below are representative of the minimum knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations will be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job. If you need such an accommodation, please email staffrecruiting@sidley.com (current employees should contact Human Resources).


Education and/or Experience:
Required:* A Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university
* Excellent writing and proofreading skills
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office and Outlook


Preferred:* Previous professional experience, especially event management and/or marketing
* Knowledge of customer relationship, pipeline, and experience management databases such as InterAction, Salesforce, and/or Foundation
* General understanding of legal competitive landscape


Other Skills and Abilities:
The following will also be required of the successful candidate:* Strong organizational skills
* Strong attention to detail
* Good judgment
* Strong interpersonal communication skills
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Able to work harmoniously and effectively with others
* Able to preserve confidentiality and exercise discretion
* Able to work under pressure
* Able to manage multiple projects with competing deadlines and priorities


Sidley Austin LLP is an Equal Opportunity Employer
company_description: We are proud to offer lawyers and professional staff myriad opportunities to apply their talents toward important, challenging projects on a global stage.

title: Central Supply Clerk- LIC
description:
Overview:

At New York Blood Center, one of the most comprehensive blood centers in the world, our focus is on cultivating excellence by merging cutting-edge innovation with diligent customer service, groundbreaking research, and comprehensive program and service development. Join us as we work towards meeting and exceeding the growing needs of our diverse communities, further our lifesaving strategic goals in a rapidly changing environment, and expand our impact on the local, national, and global communities we serve.
Responsibilities:
* Assists with collection operations by packing hampers and canteens for operations.
* Distributes rolls to appropriate affiliates, packs medical waste, fills truck requisitions and prepares donor rooms.
* Verifies deliveries and maintains inventory and distribute supplies.
* Unloads delivery trucks and stocks mobile truck inventory.
* Checks and signs all deliveries and performs a complete inventory twice a year and consolidates stock items.
* Restocks shelves and fills hospital and apheresis requisitions and maintains cleanliness and security of stockroom and checks inventory levels on trucks and in the Central Supply area.
* Maintains and cleans equipment, cleans and calibrates; BP cuffs, hemocues, donor scales and checks and cleans blood coolers.
* Sterilizes hand tools and glassware and sorts items in sterile hampers.
* Cleans coffee machines, water jugs, coffee pots, coolers, pitchers and other items from operations.
* Maintains a daily collection report and all other necessary paperwork.
* Ensures that adequate supplies are maintained for all collections operations. Ensures that departmental equipment is cleaned and properly functioning and calibrated as necesssary. Receives, distributes, and delivers stock for operations.


Qualifications:

Education:
High School Diploma or equivalent  

Experience:
2yrs warehouse/shipping receiving experience.  

Skills and Abilities:
Ability to lift up to 50 lbs. Good communication skill. Detailed orientated.  

All salaries are pursuant to Local 202 Collective Bargaining Agreement.
Rate: $20.78 Per Hour **Unless otherwise specified, all posted opportunities are located in the New York or Greater Tri-State office locations**

title: Tech Assistant
description:
Job Description:

Artificial Intelligence; Advanced Technology; The very best in patient care. With decades of expertise, we are *Radiology Forward*. With dynamic cross-training and advancement opportunities in a team-focused environment, the core of our success is its people with the commitment to a better healthcare experience. When you join us as a ***Technologist Aide*** you will be joining a dedicated team of professionals who deliver quality, value, and access in the 21st century and align all stakeholders- patients, providers, payors, and regulators to achieve the best clinical outcomes. **You Will:*** Greet, register, collect copays, and verify all patient information. Assist team members by notifying patient arrival. Communicate delays in appointments in a timely fashion and offers rescheduling for timely and effective care of patients;
* Obtain proper insurance/authorizations and patient information, collects signatures and ensures accuracy and completion of necessary documentation.
* Schedules, reschedules or cancels new or current patients, confirms appointments and notifies staff of changes when necessary.
* Ensure that equipment and tools are sterilized in each department before every patient exam.
* Assist technologists with patients

 **If You Are:*** Passionate about patient care and exercise sound judgement and an ability to remain professional in all situations.
* You demonstrate effective and professional communication, interpersonal skills and respect with patients, guests & colleagues.
* You have a structured work-approach, understand complex problems are and you are able to prioritize work in a fast-paced environment.

 **To Ensure Success in This Role, You Must Have:*** High School Diploma
* 1 year of previous medical office experience and intermediate computer skills
* Medical terminology knowledge and recent medical/radiology office work experience is preferred.

  


Pay Range: USD $16.00 - USD $24.00 /per hour Shift: Varied Shift Variations: PRN as needed

title: Service Center Trainee
description:
Overview:  

In this role you will service and counsel policyholders on their personal insurance needs as a trusted insurance advisor. You will be providing service on behalf of our agency partners.

**Essential Functions and Responsibilities**

  

* Develop and maintain product knowledge of all lines of business (Personal Auto, Homeowner and Umbrella) across all regions.
* Exceed the expectations of customers and agents, always providing professional and efficient service through positive interactions and extensive product knowledge.
* Identify customer opportunities to educate, quote and sell our personal lines insurance products.
* Conduct periodic renewal reviews with policyholders and provide recommendations to address potential insurance gaps.
* Develop and foster Agent/Company relationships.
* Engage in proactive efforts to exceed departmental and company objectives.
* Demonstrate willingness and ability to learn.
* Assist other departments when the need arises to perform duties as assigned.

 **Qualifications and Education**

* Excellent listening, communication, and organizational skills.
* Must have excellent interpersonal skills and possess the ability to work independently and in a team environment.
* Strong attention to detail required.
* Sales-related experience a plus.
* Bachelor's degree (B. A.) from a four-year college or university; or two to three years related experience.
* Property & Casualty license a plus.
* Personal Lines experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
* Flexible schedule a plus.
* Must obtain a NJ Property and Casualty Insurance producer license within the first 3 months of employment date.
* Must be able to handle a high volume of in-bound and out-bound calls within time standards while maintaining a professional demeanor.

**About the Company**


*The Plymouth Rock Company and its affiliated group of companies write and manage over $2 billion in personal and commercial auto and homeowner’s insurance throughout the Northeast and mid-Atlantic, where we have built an unparalleled reputation for service. We continuously invest in technology, our employees thrive in our empowering environment, and our customers are among the most loyal in the industry. The Plymouth Rock group of companies employs more than 1,900 people and is headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts. Plymouth Rock Assurance Corporation holds an A.M. Best rating of “A-/Excellent”.*

title: Customer Care Representative
description:
Overview:

Are you ready to embark on a rewarding career journey? At Plymouth Rock, we pride ourselves on fostering a dynamic and supportive service center environment where professionalism and teamwork are highly valued. If you’re the kind of person who enjoys solving problems and helping others when they need it, this could be a great opportunity to start your career at Plymouth Rock!  

We’re currently seeking passionate individuals to join our team as Customer Care Representatives, where you'll play a pivotal role in providing exceptional service to our valued customers, agents, and partners. As a Customer Care Representative, you'll be at the forefront of our customer interactions, handling inbound calls with efficiency and professionalism.  

**Essential Functions and Responsibilities*** Answer inquiries via phone, email and texting regarding policies, coverages, and premiums with confidence and accuracy.

title: Claims Trainee, Property Damage
description:
Overview:

This individual is responsible for the handling of Auto Property Claims in accordance with NJ Unfair Practices Act. The environment is fast paced with heavy phone work. The position requires patience and the ability to function professionally in adversarial situations.

**Essential Functions and Responsibilities**

* Investigate and interpret policy provisions, endorsements and conditions to make a coverage determination in the automobile property claim.
* Identify and investigate Contested Coverage Claims with recommendation prepared for coverage committee.
* Responsible for the investigation of the auto accident to make a liability assessment. This includes interviewing first and third party claimants, witnesses, investigating officers and other relevant parties, along with securing pertinent records, documentation and loss scene information.
* Analyze the investigation to determine proximate cause, negligence, and damages.
* Evaluate and adjust reserves as necessary.
* Prepare dispatch instructions for field personnel to inspect vehicles.
* Negotiate and settle claims within his/her individual authority.
* Submit claims for approval to supervisor when over his/her authority or for guidance, review and/or referral when appropriate.
* Maintain an effective follow-up system on pending files.
* Prioritize and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Adjust to fluctuating workload.
* Advise insureds, claimants, brokers on the status of the claim.
* Act as an intermediary between the Company, preferred vendors and customers.
* Resolve all disputes that may arise.
* Ensure that service, loss and expense control are maintained at all times.
* Adhere to privacy guidelines, law and regulations pertaining to claims handling.
* Investigate and initiate subrogation when applicable.
* Handle and respond to arbitration and special civil part lawsuits pertaining to property damage.
* Participate in catastrophic claim handling as requested/needed. This may include traveling to other locations and extended hours.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Qualifications and Education*** Strong customer service, organizational, verbal, and written skills are required.
* Basic personal computer skills including working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite products.
* Bachelor’s Degree from a four-year college or university required and/or 3-5 years of equivalent experience.
* Recent college graduates are encouraged to apply!

**About the Company**


The Plymouth Rock Company and its affiliated group of companies write and manage over $2 billion in personal and commercial auto and homeowner’s insurance throughout the Northeast and mid-Atlantic, where we have built an unparalleled reputation for service. We continuously invest in technology, our employees thrive in our empowering environment, and our customers are among the most loyal in the industry. The Plymouth Rock group of companies employs more than 1,900 people and is headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts. Plymouth Rock Assurance Corporation holds an A.M. Best rating of “A-/Excellent”.

title: Marketing Manager
description:
**Description**  



  

**Your role at GEI.**  

  

GEI seeks a Marketing Manager to help support growth in East Region with the production of high-quality proposal and qualification efforts and to support the regions ongoing development and implementation of the region’s strategic planning efforts. The Marketing Manager for will work across GEI’s East region leading large scale strategic proposal efforts and serving in a management and reviewer role for mid to small scale proposals. They will also work with our talented team of seller-doers to drive business in offices in the Mid-Atlantic (Southern New Jersey to Virginia). This marketer will produce high quality, winning proposal and qualification packages, support business development efforts and identify opportunities, and provide a deep knowledge and understanding of marketing in the AEC industry. The successful candidate is organized and can easily handle multiple deadline driven opportunities at once; run effective Go/No-Go discussions; drive the proposal process from Go/No-Go through proposal submission, interview, and debrief; and has a strong desire and ability to execute high quality marketing products.  

  

GEI seeks a committed, self-motivated, organized and detail-oriented individual who anticipates issues and thrives on creative, independent problem solving within a rapid, deadline-driven environment.
  

  

The Marketing Professional will be part of GEI’s highly respected marketing organization at GEI and a member of the East Region marketing team reporting to the East Region Marketing Manager. This position may support other marketing efforts across the country. As a part of this larger team, there is ample opportunity for mentorship, growth, and teamwork.  

  

This position may be located in any of GEI’s offices along the East coast from Maine to Virigina though location is preferred at GEI’s headquarters in Woburn, MA. Many marketing staff are centrally located in Woburn, MA which provides for a lively, collaborative marketing team environment. Monthly to quarterly travel to other offices anticipated.  

  

**Essential Responsibilities & Duties**  

* Provide marketing support for opportunities through the entire sales cycle including opportunity and lead identification and tracking, Go/No-Go discussions, capture planning, proposal management and development, and interview support.
* Support development of proposals; understand RFP requirements; develop and pro-actively manage task list and process; update and prepare documents (resumes, project write-ups, proposals, company services, matrices, SOQs, SF330 and other related documents); edit covers and graphics, content development, format, review, and edit final documents, coordinate subconsultant documents, produce final proposals; QA/QC all work products and ensure deadlines are met.
* Create responses to RFPs, SOQs, RFIs, and MSAs. Responsible for proposal/document quality, compliance, consistency in pursuit strategy/proposal themes, production, on time delivery, and win tracking.
* Drive Go/No-Go discussions in alignment with the region’s strategic priorities.
* Oversee the strategy and execution of prequalification submittals and renewals, sponsorships, and Mid-Atlantic conferences with support from others.
* Serve as senior marketing reviewer on proposals as needed. Assist with mentorship and growth of junior staff.
* Update/maintain various written marketing collateral including project sheets, resumes, award submittals, brochures, templates, media relations pieces, and project interview content.
* Assist with the planning and execution of company marketing events such as conferences, seminars, and other outreach events. This may include virtual and/or in person events.
* Involvement with marketing professional societies or similar organizations to ensure continuous professional development. Participate in professional society events to promote networking and client relations.
* Establish and maintain effective and collaborative relationships with senior seller-doers.
* Maintain current information in the marketing databases related to opportunities, projects, personnel, and general knowledge. Develops reports to extract information from the marketing database.
* Provides market intelligence research, including gathering, documenting, and reporting findings.
* Responsible for managing multiple marketing efforts running concurrently in varying complexity and value; scheduling workload and priorities accordingly.
* Other duties as required.

  

**Minimum Qualifications**  

* Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business, Communications, English or Journalism is preferred.
* Minimum 8 years of marketing experience in the AEC industry.
* Experience in Marketing and proposal response efforts.
* Strong written communication and organizational skills; ability to perform detail-oriented work, including document layout and production.
* A team player with strong communication, collaboration, and customer service skills
* Able to excel at detail-oriented work, including document layout and production while focusing on the larger strategy
* Technology: Proficient working with MS Office products (including Word, PowerPoint, Excel) and Adobe InDesign. Working knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite and other graphic design application packages.
* Strong organizational skills with ability to independently handle multiple tasks and meet deadlines.
* Travel: Some travel expected across the region to visit Mid-Atlantic offices and to national conferences. Less than 15% travel anticipated.

  

**We are GEI.**  

  

Some of the world’s most pressing problems – from climate change to sustainable development, to critical infrastructure and the future of our energy supply – need our brightest and diverse minds working together to create safer, more resilient communities for tomorrow.  

  

We are technical experts, collaborators, and entrepreneurs who draw from diverse backgrounds to solve our clients’ most complex challenges.  

  

With nearly 60 offices across North America, we offer a range of engineering, science, and technical consulting services. Our range of expertise, project types, and culture make us the choice for top talent in the AEC industry.  

  

**Employee-owned. Employee-focused.**  

  

As a 100% employee-owned company, our employees support our flat leadership structure, have a say in how our business operates and benefit from our financial success. We are committed to employee growth with career development opportunities, competitive total rewards, a well-being program, flexible work arrangements and more. Our company culture is driven by our 4 Cs – we are Client-Centered, Curious, Collaborative, and Community Minded – which support our focus on sustainability, safety, diversity, equity and inclusion. Get to know us better by visiting GEI’s career site here.  

  

**GEI’s Total Rewards Package Includes*** Market-Competitive Compensation, including Eligibility for an Annual Performance Bonus
* Pay Range For This Position: $100,000.00 – $110,000.00/year
* Comprehensive Benefits Program, including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Disability and More
* Well-Being Program and Paid Parental Leave
* Commuter Benefits
* Hybrid Work Schedules and Cell Phone Stipends

company_description: GEI Consultants is one of the nation’s leading geotechnical, environmental, water resources and ecological science and engineering firms.

title: Technical Pharmacovigilance Product Specialist
description:
**About Us:**  

Cognizant (Nasdaq: CTSH) engineers’ modern businesses. We help our clients modernize technology, reimagine processes and transform experiences so they can stay ahead in our fast-changing world. Together, we're improving everyday life. See how at www.cognizant.com
  

The role is encouraged to drive technology discussions and analyze the current landscape for gaps in addressing business needs. Cognizant needs a motivated individual to challenge the status quo and provide thought leadership/standard methodologies to improve our current services and technologies.


**Role:** Technical Pharmacovigilance Product Specialist


**Roles/Responsibilities:**  

* 5+ years of IT Industry work experience in Analysis, Design, Development, Testing and Maintenance of software applications in Health & Life Sciences with various types of Software Development Lifecycle methodologies
* Oversee the end-to-end product lifecycle management, ensuring timely delivery and quality.
* Provide technical expertise and support for PV systems, addressing any issues that arise.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze requirements for new features and enhancements.
* Develop and maintain detailed project plans, schedules, and status reports to ensure project milestones are met.
* Ensure compliance with industry standards and regulatory requirements, particularly in Research and Development and Medical Devices domains.
* Conduct regular system audits and performance tuning to optimize PV systems.
* Train and mentor junior team members on PV best practices and project methodologies.
* Facilitate effective communication between stakeholders, including clients, team members, and management.
* Identify and mitigate risks associated with PV system implementations and upgrades.
* Provide post-implementation support and troubleshooting to ensure system stability and user satisfaction.
* Participate in continuous improvement initiatives to enhance product quality and project delivery processes.
* Contribute to the development of technical documentation, including user guides and system manuals. - Qualifications - Possess strong technical skills in PV industry.
* Have a solid understanding of product lifecycle management and project management methodologies.
* Demonstrate experience in Research and Development or Medical Devices domains is a plus.
* Exhibit excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Show proficiency in developing and maintaining project plans and schedules.
* Display strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Be capable of training and mentoring junior team members.
* Have a keen eye for detail and a commitment to quality.

**Required Qualifications:**  

* Bachelor’s degree with minimum 3 years of experience on Pharmacovigilance systems.
* Experienced on SQL, PLSQL, ITIL, Ticketing tool, HP ALM, COTS Product Knowledge.
* Innovation Effective, Communication Strategic Orientation Client Focus Managing Change Execution Excellence Managing Teams Build Collaborative Relations

**Salary and Other Compensation:**  

The annual salary for this position is depending on experience and other qualifications of the successful candidate.  

This position is also eligible for Cognizant’s discretionary annual incentive program, based on performance and subject to the terms of Cognizant’s applicable plans.  

Benefits: Cognizant offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements:  

Medical/Dental/Vision/Life Insurance  

Paid holidays plus Paid Time Off  

401(k) plan and contributions  

Long-term/Short-term Disability  

Paid Parental Leave  

Employee Stock Purchase Plan


Disclaimer: The salary, other compensation, and benefits information is accurate as of the date of this posting. Cognizant reserves the right to modify this information at any time, subject to applicable law.
